intro: Tibouchina bipenicillata, commonly known as the pink hibiscus mealybug plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy pink or purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. However, it is also known to host the pink hibiscus mealybug, which can be a pest in some regions.
